channel.title: 317 Delta [FIXED]
channel.description:
Okay so I don't normally need help but iv'e tried everything and it's just pissing me off.
All I'm doing is making some simple custom yells but after I change the names and everything it just doesn't work. It works for the ones that are already there but if I say for example change one of those names to my name, It doesn't work. I just did that (replaced the names) and it messed the whole yell system up. Like the colors were all jacked up and crap lol.
317 Delta, any ideas?
EDIT: Just figured out it only doesn't work if you are an owner.

item.title: 317 Delta [FIXED]
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:7, topic:523110”][quote author=deadlyhorror link=topic=641662.msg4322415#msg4322415 date=1372379491]
It wasn’t an error, It just didn’t change the yell title at all, you should know its Project Rainbow :o
[/quote]
I’ll assume the source is still as bad as it is when it was released and everything is still stuffed in Client.java.

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("YOUR NAME HERE")) {
    return "@whi@[@cya@Dev@gre@elo@cya@per@whi@]" + playerName + ": " 
		+ new StringBuilder().append(Character.toUpperCase
                              (text.charAt(0))).append(text.substring(1));

Please repackage the source if you do intend to actually use it. :o[/quote]

Yeah it is , I’m not really looking for a source to host, I’m just trying to get more experience with new revisions/bases

EDIT: I replaced mine with the one u gave me and it didnt change anything.

This is how it looks no matter how I change my title (except the bracket colors, I guess I messed those up somehow):

EDIT AGAIN: Alright well I just moved it out of the method and it started working so thanks anyways!

Read full topic

if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("Deadlyhorror")) return ((new StringBuilder()).append("@whi@[@cya@Dev@gre@elo@cya@per@whi@] @mag@").append(name).append(": @mag@").append(Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0X0))).append(text.substring(0x1)).toString());[/quote]
